# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the definition of the `wrap_string` function:
```
function wrap_string(words::Vector{String}, text_width::Int = 10)
    wrapped_text = ""
    current_line_length = 0
    for word in words
        if current_line_length + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            current_line_length = 0
        end
        wrapped_text *= word
        current_line_length += length(word)
    end
    return wrapped_text
end
```
Example usage:
```
julia> wrap_string(["This", "is", "a", "long", "sentence"], 10)
"This is a\nlong sentence"

julia> wrap_string(["This", "is", "a", "longer", "sentence"], 10)
"This is a\nlonger\nsentence"
```
